description: Numbers n such that if one writes n = Product p_i^e_i (p_i primes) and P = max p_i^e_i, then n/P > P.
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: ok[n_] := n > Max[Power @@@ FactorInteger[n]]^2; Select[Range[465], ok] (* _Jean-FranÃ§ois Alcover_, Apr 11 2011 *)
prog: (Haskell)a051283 n = a051283_list !! (n-1)a051283_list = filter (\x -> (a034699 x) ^ 2 < x) [1..]-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, May 30 2013
author: _Leroy Quet_
extensions: More terms from _James A. Sellers_, Dec 11 1999
